titles.title: United States Patent and Trademark Office Supplemental Appropriations Act, 2010
United States Patent and Trademark Office Supplemental Appropriations Act, 2010
United States Patent and Trademark Office Supplemental Appropriations Act, 2010
United States Patent and Trademark Office Supplemental Appropriations Act, 2010
Making supplemental appropriations for the United States Patent and Trademark Office for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2010, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Appropriations.
Mr. Mollohan moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 5874.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

vote.text: Received in the Senate, read twice, considered, read the third time, and passed without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 8/10/2010--Public Law. United States Patent and Trademark Office Supplemental Appropriations Act, 2010 - Makes supplemental FY2010 appropriations of $129 million to the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office of the Department of Commerce. Rescinds the same amount of appropriations, currently available under the Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2010 for periodic censuses and programs, from the Bureau of the Census.
